summary:
Microsoft and Linux certified, ambitious, creative, open-minded and reliable IT expert with well-developed Technical Support, System / Network Administrator skills combined with a flexible attitude towards work. Perfectly bilingual in English and Dutch (oral and written) and posses USA/UK/NL citizenships allowing me to relate to a variety of people and cultures. Currently employed as a full-time IT Administrator. In possession of Drivers License B and a car.

Assisted with projects ranging from hands-on Technical Support to full-on System/Network/VPN solutions of medium to large organizations globally.

Specialties: System / Network Administration, Technical Support, Migrations, Hypervisors, End-of-Life Asset Management and Scripting.

NL', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Utrecht Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Midas Will Fix IT . NL', 'description': "Midas Will Fix IT is a one-man company that was founded by Michael Barton in early January 2007 with the aim to satisfy as many customers as possible with their computer needs. Mr. Barton explains everything to his customers with basic concepts and step-by-step instructions.

The name Midas Will Fix IT comes from Greek mythology, from King Midas, everything he touched became gold. Mr. Barton is often told that he has the 'Touch of Midas' when it comes to computers and he can do almost anything with computers quickly and professionally. The company name sounds like 'might as well fix it' which is also a central principle within the company, Mr. Barton moreover fixes the problem instead of resetting the computer in its entirety, this so that you can quickly pick up work where you left off.

'A computer remains a computer' which is why Mr. Barton breathes new life into computers to build rich and powerful servers. In this fashion Mr. Barton can easily create a webshop with any computer, making the computer that he 'touches' a money making machine, figuratively 'gold'. In this way you can also easily host your own website, share files, build an E-mail server, build a media center, a router, a telephone exchange and much more.

Midas Will Fix IT has helped over 100 individuals. Please see his site for more references.", 'title': 'Owner', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Atlas Copco', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Apeldoorn, Oosterhout, Zwijndrecht, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Atlas Copco', 'description': "I became solely responsible for catching up on a huge backlog of outstanding service tickets. Throughout this process I prepared the recently acquired Cirmac BV for a move to a new building and server environment. Shortly after the move, I handled the abundant service requests coming in, also for 3 other sites, and have been trying to keep the IT infra afloat for roughly 150+ employees. I've helped 2 sites with massive migrations during which I helped facilitate all network infra from setting up the WiFi connections, workplaces and telephones to the e-mail, file, print and phone servers and all the new colored and organised wiring. After successfully prioritizing and finishing bare necessities, I started to determine future projects including setting up the phone system in a more robust way, standardizing PC installations and cleaning up network access groups/levels throughout Atlas Copco Netherlands. For a System's Administrator this is not the most challenging function but the people are great, extremely happy with me and I'm becoming quite the Lotus Notes expert.", 'title': 'Technical Support', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2029, 'name': 'Nike EMEA', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFckBxRnPg53Q/company-logo_400_400/0/1630594333146/nike_logo?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=chxU83Dys4g6DTK5Am4aiTlAWtNh0_0Fg4ZLkQMjtRc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/nike/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Netherlands, Hilversum', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'Nike', 'description': "I worked here on project basis as a Systems's Administrator. Handling IT problems for all the 200+ Nike retail and franchise stores throughout Europe, Africa and Asia. I worked in close correspondence with the global team solving issues with Windows 2003 R2 and 2008 R2 servers as well as Mac and Windows XP to Windows 7 PCs. One of the core components to Retail Management was to coordinate HardWare Refresh; a program to liaise among Fujitsu, Atos, ACS and Torex employees to coordinate the upgrade of all store hardware over night. I had to keep files up to date and in sync (robocopy, Altiris), and sometimes handle smaller IT issues such as fixing Traffic Counters and Cash Registers. In my short time here, I picked up the system quickly and even solved a small amount of ongoing colossal failures. This was also one of my favorite positions given the international nature of the company combined with the driving health aspects of working at a multinational sports and health concern.", 'title': 'IT Operations Technical Engineer Retail Stores', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1408476, 'name': 'Bibliotheek Nieuwegein', 'logo': None, 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/bibliotheek-nieuwegein/', 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Nieuwegein, Utrecht, NL', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'Bibliotheek Nieuwegein', 'description': "I was held partly responsible for the merging of two companies in a new building. This massive task was completed successfully in that everything came up again successfully with minimal confusion or downtime.

Together with Maarten Keyman I caught up on a uncanny backlog of outstanding service tickets. Throughout this process we prepared the Library of Nieuwegein and Stichting Welzijn Nieuwegein for a move and merge whilst offering support for 80+ users and their issues with their computers and the library system. After successfully prioritizing and finishing bare necessities, eg. mapping of the corporate network, we were also held responsible for determining future endeavors with regards to improving the infrastructure.
